ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí panzwě, pi sẅíʼi mbùm gi ńnáa ssé mvfò melúm pí, à cʉa púʼu, ńgwɔ́ gie tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ne ńdʉʼʉ lézáb ntʉ́m na shwóŋè Ssé, pɔ́ cʉ́me nzèm pi té gwɔ́ gie pi gɔ̌ɔn nò, éfó na tsẅé gí.
en: In the same way, wives,   submit yourselves to your own husbands so that, even if some disobey the word,  # 3:1 1Co 7:16; 1Pt 1:24–25 they may be won over  # 3:1 1Co 9:19–22; Php 3:8 without a word by the way their wives live  # 3:1 2Pt 3:11

ngiemboon: Mbà pɔ́ gyǎ kwò legìŋ gí gie lɔ̌ʼ té mǒ wɔ́, á piŋ ńgẅiin mekùʼ.
en: when they observe your pure, reverent lives.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn lékẅiŋ mbùm gi pɔ́ nzème pǐ, páʼ lenyɛ̀te ḿbáʼa twó gí, ńjÿɔ́g mekwáŋ mie mé lɔgɔ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, ḿmaʼa menzsǒ mbòŋo.
en: Don’t let your beauty consist of outward things like elaborate hairstyles and wearing gold jewelry or fine clothes,

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie à gí kẅìŋennɛ́ fó pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí. Lepʉlé pʉ́le té faʼ ntsaŋ áa kẅìŋennɛ́ gie á téen ńdáʼa ńcʉŋte wɔ́. Áa mbwó Ssé nzẅìŋ wé gwɔ́ wó tɛʼ.
en: but rather what is inside the heart  ,# 3:4 Rm 2:29; 7:22  #— #the imperishable quality of a gentle  # 3:4 Mt 5:5 and quiet  # 3:4 1Tm 2:2 spirit, which is of great worth in God’s sight.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ zɔɔ ńtí gie panzwě pe fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò pie é lɔ́ɔn ḿbɔ́gɔ Ssé, ńnéŋe ne ńzẅíʼte mmó gie Ssé la kaʼ, lɔ́ɔn ńkẅiŋe mbùm yɔb púʼu, ńne sẅíʼi mbùm yɔb ńnáa ssé á mvfò melúm pɔ́b,
en: For in the past, the holy   women who put their hope  # 3:5 1Tm 5:5; 1Pt 1:3 in God also adorned themselves in this way, submitting to their own husbands,

ngiemboon: páʼ Sǎlà gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńjúʼu ncwò ndúm we Ábalaham, ńtóŋo yé lê «Ndè wɔ̀ɔn.» Pi ee fʉ̀ʼɔɔn pɛ́ʼɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńgÿo nò mbòŋo té pɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ mmó, mbà pi ge cʉ́ʼ púɔ pé pepanzwě.
en: just as Sarah   obeyed Abraham, calling him lord. You have become her children when you do what is good and do not fear any intimidation.  # 3:6 Pr 3:25

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí mbàŋa pi gẅiin panzwě pi mboŋó, ńkímte páʼ panzwě gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a nzɔbte zɔbté. Pi ná mekùʼ mɔ́b, á nue e Ssé la pú ńcÿó gʉm gí lâ pɔ̌ metsèm, ńgÿo páʼ pi ge láʼ gẅiin kwàʼ legwɔ́. Pi gÿo púʼu, ńne sẅíŋte Ssé, atsɔ́ mmó le gẅí táte.
en: Husbands,   in the same way, live with your wives in an understanding way, as with a weaker partner,  # 3:7 1Th 4:4 showing them honor as coheirs of the grace of life, so that your prayers will not be hindered.

ngiemboon: N ge gwaa cʉ́me, é gɔɔn fʉ̀ʼɔɔn mbwó mânyìŋ ntsèm ngie, pi gẅiin tàʼ ncwò, nyìŋ gẅi gyá nò nyìŋ páʼ yé, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe, ńgẅiin nkwòŋe mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌, ńná nnɛ́ ssé.
en: Finally, all of you be like-minded and sympathetic, love one another,   and be compassionate  # 3:8 Eph 4:32 and humble,  # 3:8 Other mss read courteous

ngiemboon: Tà pi lɔgɔ nò tepòŋ ńtsɔ́ʼɔ nò tepòŋ. Tà mé zoonte gẅí pi pʉŋe. Tà ńcʉ́ʼ púʼu, pi gɔɔn ngie e Ssé gwɔ́ né ngàŋ, e Ssé la tsɔ́ʼɔ gẅí pɔ́ páʼ à ge gwɔ́ né pi.
en: not paying back evil for evil   or insult for insult but, on the contrary, giving a blessing,  # 3:9 Lk 6:28; Rm 12:14; 1Co 4:12 since you were called for this, so that you may inherit a blessing.

ngiemboon: Mé la zɔɔn ńŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie:
en: For the    one who wants to love life

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie à lÿɔ́ʼɔ nò tepòŋ, ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo,
en: and let him turn away    from evil

ngiemboon: Á nue menÿɔ́g Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tyé na pʉ̀a pie é gÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: because the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńnéŋe twó ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo, mbà wɔ́ ge gÿo nò tepòŋ na pi?
en: Who then will harm you if you are devoted to what is good?

ngiemboon: Pi ke fó lyɛ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́ gyá ngɔ́ʼ, á gwɔ́ nue pi ne ńgÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, mbà pi ee pashÿó mbòŋo. Tà pi mɔ́ɔn tà ḿbɔ́g pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Tà ntʉ́m nyìŋ gẅi mɔ́ɔn tà ḿvɛ.
en: But even if you should suffer for righteousness,   you are blessed. Do not fear them   # 3:14 Or Do not fear what they fear,# 3:14 Jn 6:20; 7:13or be intimidated,   # 3:14 Is 8:12,# 3:14–15 Is 8:12–13

ngiemboon: Tá ńcʉ́ʼ púʼu, pi gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí, ńne ńnáa pɔ́ mekùʼ Keleto ngie yé zɔɔ Ndè gẅi. Pi gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm ńtyé pɔ́ páʼ nyìŋ zɛ́te gẅí ngie mélàʼakɔ́ pi tÿɔ́g nkwaŋá gẅí na Keleto wɔ́ɔ, pi kyɛ́ʼte shwóŋo ngàŋ.
en: but in your hearts regard   Christ  # 3:15 Other mss read set God the Lord as holy, ready at any time to give a defense to anyone who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you.  # 3:15 1Jn 4:4

ngiemboon: Ńcʉ́ʼʉ léshwóŋo yé ńdɔg pɔ́ ndɔɔn ndɔɔn, ńdɔg mekùʼ. Á poŋ ngie tà mbùm gi gwaa gwɔ́ ńne ńcúɔ gẅí na tsɔ́ mmó, tá à cʉa púʼu, ńgwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a lɔɔn ńne ńtÿɔ́gɔ sóon twó pi, éfó na páʼ pɔ́ ne ńzoonte lenéŋè gẅi we pʉ̀a Keleto, gẅie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ, eshʉ́ kúu wɔ́b.
en: Yet do this with gentleness and reverence, keeping a clear conscience,   so that when you are accused,  # 3:16 Other mss read when they speak against you as evildoers those who disparage your good conduct in Christ will be put to shame.

ngiemboon: Mvfò aa nyìŋ légwaa gyá ngɔ́ʼ ńne ńgÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo páʼ Ssé lɔɔn ńkwoŋ ngie à gwɔ́ púʼu, ńcʉa páʼ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gwaa gyá ngɔ́ʼ, ńne ńgÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: For it is better to suffer   for doing good, if that should be God’s will, than for doing evil.

ngiemboon: Keleto la zɔɔn ńgyá yé ngɔ́ʼ tà ńkwé lélɔg ńzyɛ́b menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńké ńkwé ndàʼ tàʼ legʉ̀a, á kuʼ. Yé te fʉa kwé ńtí ngàŋ mefʉa, púʼu, lélɔgɔ gẅí ńtóo mvfò Ssé. Mé la zẅé mbab nnɛ́ ye, tá Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gÿo á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: For Christ also suffered   for sins once for all,  # 3:18 Rm 6:10; Heb 9:28; 10:10; 1Pt 2:21; 4:1 the righteous for the unrighteous, that he might bring you to God.  # 3:18 Rm 5:2 He was put to death in the flesh  # 3:18 Or by the flesh, or in the fleshly realm,# 3:18 Eph 2:14 but made alive by the Spirit,  # 3:18 Or in the spirit, or in the Spirit, or in the spiritual realm

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ŋwɛ́ gÿo á gʉa láʼ mepfó é shwóŋo nò Ssé mbwó mezẅìge pʉ̀a mesoŋ mie é laa ndátsǎŋ.
en: in which   he also went and made proclamation to the spirits  # 3:19 1Jn 4:1 in prison

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ mezẅìge gwɔ́ mé pʉ̀a pie é la tʉʉ twó mbwó Ssé á fʉ̀ʼ gie Nowa la ne ńnyɛte kanúʼ, e Ssé ne ńdɔgɔ kwɔ̀gɔnnɛ́ ńzẅíʼte pʉ̀a zẅíʼte. Táʼ, pʉ̀a lefɔ̌ɔn ndàʼ zɔ̌ gÿo ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ tà ńtsẅɛ́ ntse.
en: who in the past were disobedient, when God patiently waited in the days of Noah   while the ark was being prepared. In it a few #— #that is, eight people  # 3:20 Or souls,# 3:20 Gn 5:32; 6:18; 7:7,13; 8:16,18  #— #were saved through water.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ ntse é laa liŋé kẅéntse gie á gÿo pi tsẅɛ́ɛ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn lɔɔn. Mé téen ńdɔgɔ sɔgɔ pɔ́ ncÿǒ na mbùm nnɛ́ wɔ́. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńdúɔ mbwó Ssé ngie à sɔg mentʉ́m mégè, é le gíŋe ńŋaga wégè wɔ́. Akẅéntse lɔgɔ púʼu, ńgÿo pi tsẅɛ́ɛ, ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ páʼ Yěsô Keleto la zíme na legwé.
en: Baptism, which corresponds to this, now saves you (not as the removal of dirt from the body,   but the pledge  # 3:21 Or the appeal of a good conscience toward God) through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,  # 3:21 1Pt 1:3

ngiemboon: À la kwɔ́ʼ né tÿǒ lepwó, ńnéŋe na gwoŋó pwó Ssé yetʉ̀. Aa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńne sáʼa mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé ntsèm, ńne sáʼa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á sáʼa njÿó, ésáʼa metʉ̀ ntsèm mie ée tÿǒ.
en: who has gone into heaven   and is at the right hand of God  # 3:22 Ps 110:1; Mk 16:19; Ac 2:33–34; Rm 8:34; Heb 10:12 with angels, authorities, and powers subject to him.  # 3:22 Eph 1:20–22
